individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed with early-onset Alzheimer's disease at age 64.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P2 exhibited significant cognitive decline and was diagnosed at age 69.

Patient P4 has not shown any symptoms of Alzheimer's disease.

functional_data.summary: The N98A variant showed improved inhibition of Aβ aggregation compared to wild-type TTR.

variants.segregation_data: The N98A variant segregates with Alzheimer's disease in the studied families.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on functional assays and clinical correlation.
variants.additional_notes: The N98A variant was specifically noted for its functional impact on Aβ aggregation.
key_quotes: The N98A mutation was more effective at inhibiting Aβ aggregation than wild-type TTR.
Patient P1 was diagnosed with early-onset Alzheimer's disease at age 64.
